200701-d-12-17-07-EWG.Narrative: PLEASE SEE ATTACHED REPORT.  NO DRUG/ALCOHOL INVOLVEMENT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS DERAILMENT.  PRIMARY CAUSE ESTIMATED TO BE BROKEN COMPROMISE JOINT, WHICH OCCURRED SOMETIME DURING TRAIN PASSAGE, COUPLEDWITH SHARP FLANGE (FINGER READING, 7/16 INCHES METAL TO BE CUT TO RESTORE FULL FLANGE CONTOUR; FLANGE HEIGHT, 0 OR 4, 1 1/4 INCHES) ON TLCX 31792 LEAD TRUCK, CAUSING DERAILMENT.  OPERATING A LOADED GRAIN MOVEMENT EAST THROUGH THE       " CANYON" , AT MP 61.5.  HAD 2 LOCOMOTIVES (MRL 260-NIWX 8924) WITH 64X0, 8448 TONS, ABOUT 3850 FEET TRAVELING DOWN GRADE IN FULL DYNAMIC BRAKING.  AS THE SPEED BEGAN TO INCREASE OVER 10 MPH ( MAXIMUM TRACK SPEED FOR THAT AREA) BEGAN USING THE AUTOMATIC BRAKE, DRAWING OFF ABOUT 15 LBS AS THE HEAVY TRAIN CONTINUED TO SHOVE ME DOWN THE 1.2 % DESCENT INTO THE CANYON AREA.  USED MORE AUTOMATIC BRAKE TO ABOUT 23 LBS, AS THE SPEED BEGAN STABILIZING BETWEEN 10 TO 12MPH.  AT THE 61.5, THE GRADE BOTTOMS OUT AND BEGINS A 1.2 % CLIMB OUT OF THE CANYON AREA.  CONTINUEDIN FULL DYNAMIC BRAKING AS THE LOCOMOTIVES TURNED UP THE GRADE.  RELEASING THE AUTOMATIC BRAKE ABOUT THE 61.3, BUT STILL HOLDING FULL DYNAMIC BRAKING, THE TRAIN SETTLED INTO A 10 MPH ROLL THROUGH THEDIP.  WATCHING SPEEDOMETER CLOSELY, BEGAN TO LOSE SPEED, SLOWLY CAME OUT OF DYNAMIC BRAKING, CHANGING TO POWER TO PULL THE SHORT, HEAVY TRAIN BACK UP OUT OF THE CANYON.  BY THE TIME THE ENGINES WEREPASSING THE 61 MILEPOST, I WAS ALREADY IN NOTCH 7, PULLING HEAVILY ABOUT 800 AMPS.  HOLDING A 10MPH

121407-d-12-14-07-UTAX.Primary Accident Cause: Other frog, switch and track appliance defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
121407-d-12-14-07-UTAX.Accident Cause: Other frog, switch and track appliance defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
121407-d-12-14-07-UTAX.Narrative: TRAIN 3 SB, OPERATED BY 4548 (4548) REPORTED A RED SIGNAL TO TRAX CONTROL CENTER (TCC) AT CUSHING 6(SC6) INTERLOCKING.  TCC INSTRUCTED 4548 TO CALL ROUTE FROM ROUTE SELECTOR AT 7720 SOUTH STATION.  4548 ENTERED ROUTE REQUEST, WITH NO CHANGE TO RED SIGNAL.  4548 ADVISED TCC OF PERSISTENT RED SIGNAL.TCC AUTHORIZED RED SIGNAL BY-PASS PURSUANT TO RULE 11.09-"THE OPERATOR MUST NOT PROCEED BEFORE OBSERVING THAT SWITCHES ARE PROPERLY LINED AND THAT THER ARE NO CONFLICTING TRAIN MOVEMENTSAT EVERY FACING POINT SWITCH GOVERNED BY THE SIGNAL BEING BY-PASSED THE TRAIN OPERATOR MUST STOP AND VERIFY THESWITCH IS ALIGNED FOR PROPER MOVEMENT:.  4548 REPORTED TO TCC THAT TRAILING SWITCH WAS ALIGNED FOR CROSSOVER MOVE, TRAIN 3 PROCEEDED TO THE FACING SWITCH AND REPORTED TO TCC THAT THE FACING SWITCH WASALIGNED.  TRAIN 3 PROCEEDED THROUGH FACING SWITCH, AND DERAILED TWO CARS OF A THREE CAR CONSIST.  TRAIN 3 TRAILED TRAILING SWITCH AND PICKED FACING SWITCH.  MOW TESTED AND EXAMINED SWITCH AND SIGNALS, FINDING NO MECHANICAL, ELECTRONIC, SIGNALING OR ELECTRICAL DEFECT.  SWITCH MOST LIKELY OUT OF CORRESPONDENCE DUE TO ICE, SNOW, TEMPERATURE CHANGE OR DEBRIS.  UTA'S CONCLUSION IS THAT 4548 VIOLATED RULE 11.09, BY FAILING TO STOP AND VERIFY BOTH SWITCH ALIGNMENTS.  UTA BELIEVES 4548 EXECUTED CROSSOVER MOVE WITH EXCESSIVE SPEED, AND WITHOUT STOPPING.  NO INJURIES.  DAMAGES LIMITED TO LRT TRUCKS ANDCOUPLERS.

2007DEC1D-d-12-27-07-PAL.Primary Accident Cause: Cause under active investigation by reporting railroad  (Amended report will be forwarded when repor
2007DEC1D-d-12-27-07-PAL.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
2007DEC1D-d-12-27-07-PAL.Narrative:
At approx. 10:35 a.m. UP through train CBRTSH-21 arrived Paducah and UP crew detrained.  At approx.3:00 p.m. that same day, P&L crew picked up the train which became train WW227. with three UP locomotives and 101 loaded coal cars, and derailed 9 loads of coal while leaving  track Zip 1 at Paducah.As a result of the derailment, 1578 feet of track was destroyed as well as extensive damage to Island Creek Bridge.  

Investigation revealed that the first point of derailment occurred 1578 feet in advance of the Island Creek Bridge.  Analysis of the event recorder data revealed that two emergency brake applications occurred.  The first occurred 1350 feet in advance of the bridge.  This indicates that the car derailed 228 feet prior to the first emergency application.  The second emergency application occurred at the bridge.  The UP crew was in possession of the train when the first emergency application occurred and when brakes released, pulled the train forward approximately 190 feet to the point of final stop.

Data from the derailment site, as well as event recorder and other information, was analyzed. Although a definitive cause for this derailment has not been established, based on analysis by P&L personnel as well as Rail Sciences, Inc. of Scottsdale, GA, there is no doubtthat the initial derailment occurred while the train was in the possession of the UP crew and thatwhen the P&L crew took possession and began leaving, the major damage occurred.

D663307-d-12-06-07-ABS.Narrative: THIS IS NOT AN ABS ACCIDENT. THIS ACCIDENT DID TAKE PLACE ON ABS TRACKS, AND THIS REPORT IS TO DOCUMENT THIS OCCURENCE. PLEASE REFER TO THE CSXT DERAILMENT REPORT ON THIS ACCIDENT. THE DERAILMENT OF THE ABOVE CONSIST IS THE RESULT OF A COLLISION BETWEEN THE Q522-06 AND AN UNMANNED CSXT RUNAWAY WORKTRAIN. THE Q522 WAS SITTING AT THE CO. RD. 59 CROSSING, HAVING BEEN DELIVERED TO THE CSXT BY AN ABSCREW AT 2130 HOURS OF DECEMBER 5, 2007. THE CSXT CREW BOARDED THE TRAIN AT APPROXIMATELY 0130 HOURSAND STARTED PREPARATIONS FOR THE TRIP TO BIRMINGHAM. THE CONDUCTOR WAS IN HIS SEAT COPYING DTC FROMTHE AY DISPATCHER, WHEN THE CROSSING GATES JUST IN FRONT OF THE TRAIN STARTED TO COME DOWN. AT THATTIME THE ENGINEER LOOKED UP AND SAW WHAT HE THOUGHT WAS A HEADLIGHT, AND BAILED AS DID THE CONDUCTOR. MOMENTS LATER THE UNMANNED CSXT WORK TRAIN CAME AROUND THE CURVE AND SLAMMED INTO THE Q522 AT 24 MILES PER HOUR PER THE EVENT RECORDER OF THE LEAD RUNAWAY UNIT (CUT OUT FROM UNIT AT CRASH SITE.) THERESULT OF THE COLLISION IS TWO DAMAGED WAMX SD40-2`S IN HEAVY BAD ORDER STATUS (WAMX 4115 HAS CRACKED BLOCK) AND WAMX 4120 IS STILL UNDERGOING INSPECTION AND REPAIR. THE LEAD CSXT UNIT IS A HEAVY BAD-ORDER, AND ON ITS SIDE. THE LEAD UNIT OF THE RUNAWAY TRAIN WAS DEMOLISHED, WITH PIECES OF WELDED RAIL FROM THE RAIL TRAIN THROUGH THE ENGINE BLOCK, AND CAVED IN ON FRONT SECTION OF UNIT. THE SECOND UNIT, A SLUG, IS HEAVY BAD ORDER AND WRECKED. THE WORK TRAIN, A WELDED RAIL TRAIN, WAS DERAILED THE

200803156-d-12-21-07-NJTR.Narrative: MISSING CARBON STRIP ON PANTOGRAPH CAUSED GROOVE TO WEAR INTO CARBON BRACKET WHICH CAUSED THE PANTOGRAPH TO BREAK WHILE CROSSING OVER IN JO INTERLOCKING.

204498-d-12-11-07-SOO.Narrative: 138-11 WAS EASTBOUND ON #2 MAIN (NS DEARBORN SUB), ROUNDING CURVE AT NS MP 500 WHEN CREW NOTICED A SEMI-TRACTOR TRAILER WAS OCCUPYING CROSSING AHEAD AT CLARKE ROAD IN A SOUTHERLY DIRECTION. AS THE TRAIN APPROACHED CROSSING, ENGINEER BEGAN TO BLOW WHISTLE AT THE WHISTLE SIGN, ALSO BEGAN RINGING BELL& NOTICED THAT THE SEMI HAD STOPPED FOR THE CSX CROSSING & THAT THE REAR OF TRAILER WAS STILL FOULING NS #2 MAIN. THERE ARE MULTIPLE MAIN TRACKS AT THIS LOCATION - SOUTH TRACKS ARE CSX & NORTH TRACKSARE NS. ENGINEER BEGAN TO SET BRAKES & CONTINUED BLOWING HORN, WHEN HE REALIZED THE SEMI WAS NOT MOVING HE IMMEDIATELY PLACED TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY. THE TRAIN STRUCK THE SEMI-TRACTOR TRAILER WHICH WASLOADED WITH COIL STEEL .  NO INJURIES TO CREW OR DRIVER. EXTENSIVE LOCOMOTIVE DAMAGE TO CP 6075. NSINDICATES APPROXIMATELY $1,500 SIGNAL DAMAGE.

204562-d-12-16-07-SOO.Narrative: 491-15 PROCEEDING WEST THRU CALLAWAY. ENGINEER WAS USING DYNAMIC BRAKING DOWN A SAG AND AIR DUMPED TOWARDS REAR, BRAKES SET UP ON REAR WITH 4 SECOND DELAY FOR HEAD END TO SET UP. THE HEAD END RAN OUTAND TRAIN BROKE IN TWO. THE DRAWBAR ON GCCX 21971 (A-END - CAR POSITION 55) BROKE & DROPPED, CAUSINGCP 385289 (CAR POSITION 56) TO DERAIL. INVESTIGATION DETERMINED SAID TRAIN ARRIVED GLENWOOD YARD ON12/16/07 WITH AIR CUT OUT ON CAR IMCX 102387 BY INBOUND CONDUCTOR AFTER PICKUP AT HUMBOLDT YARD ON12/15/07 REVEALED 'AIR BLOWING' FROM THIS CAR. TRAIN WAS SWITCHED AT GLENWOOD EARLY AM 12/16 AND WHILE SWITCH FOREMAN WAS DOING AIR TEST ON CARS THAT WERE ADDED, HE PROCEEDED TO WALK PAST THE IMCX 102887 & OBSERVED THAT THE CAR WAS CUT OUT.  SWITCH FOREMAN PROCEEDED TO CUT THE AIR BACK IN ON THE IMCX 10287, EXPERIENCED NO PROBLEMS AND LEFT THE CAR CUT IN, BUT FAILED TO INFORM ANYONE OF HIS ACTIONSWHICH LATER RESULTED IN DERAILMENT.

579005-d-12-22-07-IC.Narrative: DURING NORMAL SWITCHING OPERATIONS, R91871-22 WAS CLASSIFYING CARS ON THE SOUTH END OF A-YARD USINGTRACK MC08 TO PULL BACK INTO. WHEN THE CREW STARTED THE MOVEMENT FOR THE NEXT SWITCH, CAR UTLX 66267, WITH NO DRAWBAR, IMPACTED UTLX 668029 CAUSING THE CAR TO BE LIFTED OFF THE CENTER PIN ALLOWING THE B-END TRUCKS TO MOVE UNDER THE CAR AND SHEARING OFF THE BOTTOM OUTLET VALVE.  THIS ALLOWED APPROXIMATELY 1200 GALLONS OF SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION TO BE SPILLED ONTO THE GROUND.  U.S. ENVIRONMENTALRESPONDED TO CLEAN THE SPILL.

2007T1201-d-12-07-07-BB.Narrative: CSX TRAIN N67301 WAS OPERATING OVER BUCKINGHAM BRANCH RAILROAD WESTBOUND ON 12/7/2003.  AT MILEPOST207.8, THE TRAIN HAD AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY STOP.  TWO CARS (20 AND 21 FROM THE HEAD END) WERE DERAILED.  THE FIRST CAR, VAPX 91175, HAD R/L 1-2 OFF THE RAIL; THE SECOND CAR, VAPX 98104, HAD R/L 3-4 OFF THE RAIL.  THE FIRST DERAILED TRUCK STOPPED WITHIN 3 FEET OF THE ENTRY TO A BRIDGE.  THE POINT OFDERAILMENT WAS AT MILEPOST 202.5.  THERE WAS EVIDENCE OF POSSIBLE DRAGGING EQUIPMENT NEAR THIS LOCATION.  BOTH DERAILED CARS HAD ABOUT 10 TO 15% OF THE COAL LOAD IN THE BASE AND ALONG THE ONE SIDE WALL.  THIS AMOUNT OF LOAD LIKELY CAUSED SOME HARMONIC ROCKING.  THE FIRST DERAILED CAR LIFTED OFF THECENTER PIN.  THE TRUCK WENT INTO THE LEADING TRUCK OF THE SECOND CAR, DERAILING IT.
